alert.note: Alert for East Bay Hills; East Bay Interior Valleys; San Francisco Bay Shoreline; San Fransisco Peninsula Coast; Santa Cruz Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 28 at 12:09PM PDT by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...A cluster of showers with strong wind gusts and pea sized hail will impact portions of western Alameda, northern San Mateo and south central Contra Costa Counties through 100 PM PDT... At 1208 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of showers extending from Alameda to Highlands-Baywood Park. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oakland, Fremont, Hayward, San Mateo, San Leandro, Redwood City, Alameda, San Ramon, Union City, Walnut Creek, South San Francisco, Dublin, Newark, Danville, San Bruno, Pacifica, Menlo Park, Foster City, Burlingame and San Carlos. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these showers and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: East Bay Hills; East Bay Interior Valleys; San Francisco Bay Shoreline; San Fransisco Peninsula Coast; Santa Cruz Mountains
